User’s Manual¶

The User's Manual for the pyIsoDep package describes how to use the code and its various transmutation and decay applications.

Execution Sequence¶

The following sequence describes all the stages required to perform a transmutation and/or decay simulation.

  1. Decay and transmutation data generation: define a single or multiple TransmutationData containers.

    1.1. The user can move directly to step 2, or

    1.2. Define pre-generated cross sections sets and time-dependent traces using Cross sections Interface.

  2. Execute depletion: set depletion or decay history, and solve the Bateman equations.

  3. Post-process results: a dedicated container to store only result attributes, and methods to obtain specific values and plot results.

Description of Stored Data¶

Following a successive execution of each of the above stages, the containers will be populated with data unique to each container. The following sub-sections describe the data stored on each container:

  1. Pre- decay and transmutation data storage

  2. Post- decay and transmutation data storage

  3. Results container

Abstract Example¶

Data generation

data = TransmutationData(...)
data.ReadData(...)

Pre-generated XS data and traces (not mandatory)

xs = XsInterface(..., data)
timepoints, xsTimeSets = xs.setTimeTrace(...)

Calling Depletion

dep = MainDepletion(..., data or xsTimeSets)
dep.SetDepScenario(...)
dep.SetInitialComposition(...)
dep.SolveDepletion(method="cram")

Post-process results

res = Results(dep)
res.getvalues(...)
res.plot(...)
